content.description: Stand start on the far left-hand side of the largest water-formed feature (on the downhill side of the suspension bridge) in a decent crack. Stand up onto the shelf and then cross into a good jug near the top of the boulder with your left hand. Swing out right to another jug in the middle of the face and then top out.
content.location: Located on the left-hand side of one of the biggest water formed rock outcroppings downriver from the suspension bridge.

content.description: Stand start using perfect compression slopers in the middle of the pillar. Slap up the sides of the pillar until the left side becomes bad. Bump your left hand into a decent vertical edge. Position your right foot so that you can kind of sit on your heel on the right side of the pillar and make a powerful slap move up to a bad edge near the top. Top out using decent holds on the right side of the top.
content.location: This pillar is upriver of the suspension bridge, not down with the other problems. It is about 50 feet (or less) to the left of the suspension bridge on the inside corner of the river. You shouldn't miss it.

content.description: Stand start to the right of Diving Board Dyno right next to a large pool of water on a good jug. Dyno up to the left to the top of Diving Board Dyno and top out.
content.location: To the immediate right of Diving Board Dyno downriver of the suspension bridge.

content.description: Stand start on a well-rounded quartz knob with a high right foot. Dyno to the top - it's a massive jug.
content.location: Located downriver from the suspension bridge and to the left of No Friction. You start just above the unfortunate spray-painted smiley face.

content.description: Stand start to the right of Belly Flop on a curvy sloper feature. Move left into Belly Flop to get the good sloper jug and top out.
content.location: Downriver from the suspension bridge and to the right of Belly Flop. Currently, this is the furthest problem from the suspension bridge.

content.description: Stand start to the right of Diving Board Dyno on a tall face right next to the river. You have a good shelf to start on. After pulling off the ground, get your right foot up and then heel hook the shelf with your left foot. Reach up to an interesting triangular jug, and then stand up on the shelf - careful not to fall in the water. Top out on slopers.
content.location: Located downriver from the suspension bridge on the tallest piece of water formed rock next to the river. Stand starts on a massive shelf to the left of Diving Board Dyno.

content.description: Start standing on the bottom portion of the boulder in the middle of the face with no hands. Jump out right to a sloper jug without dabbing on the pads or the ground. Top out up from the jug.
content.location: Stand start with no hands to the right of No Friction downriver from the suspension bridge. Jumps out right to a sloper jug.

content.description: There are a few worthwhile boulder problems on slick water-formed rock. The rock itself is beautiful - but the friction is most certainly not. Climb some problems and take a dip in the adjacent swimming hole!
